source.description: Bibliography example with extra comments and PIs.

test-case.name: version_declaration-009
test-case.description: A VersionDecl cannot appear after a prolog decl.

test-case.name: version_declaration-020
test-case.description: You can't leave out the version string.

test-case.name: K2-VersionProlog-3
test-case.description: Use an invalid keyword as encoding.

test-case.name: K2-VersionProlog-3-v3
test-case.description: Use an invalid keyword as encoding.

test-case.name: version_declaration-022-v1
test-case.description: You can't swap the order of the 'version' and 'encoding' clauses.

test-case.name: version_declaration-022-v3
test-case.description: You can't swap the order of the 'version' and 'encoding' clauses.

test-case.name: version_declaration-023-v1
test-case.description: In XQuery 1.0, you can't omit the 'version' clause.

test-case.name: K-VersionProlog-1
test-case.description: A simple version declaration including encoding. Since it's implementation defined how comments before the version declaration is handled, any error is allowed.

test-case.name: version_declaration-002
test-case.description: A case of Comment-before-VersionDecl, this one without an encoding decl.

test-case.name: version_declaration-001
test-case.description: The production for VersionDecl includes the final Separator. Thus, a Comment occurring after the bulk of a VersionDecl but before the semicolon, still "occurs before the end of the version declaration".

test-case.name: version_declaration-007
test-case.description: A negative version number.

test-case.name: version_declaration-008
test-case.description: A non-numeric version string.

test-case.name: version_declaration-021
test-case.description: "2.0" is a plausible version string, but not supported.

test-case.name: VersionDecl-v1-processor-and-v3-query
test-case.description: An XQuery 1.0 processor presumably doesn't support version 3.0.

test-case.name: VersionDecl-v3-processor-and-v1-query
test-case.description: An XQuery 3.0 processor might or might not accept version "1.0".

test-case.name: version_declaration-010
test-case.description: Asterisk is not allowed in EncName.

test-case.name: version_declaration-010-v3
test-case.description: Asterisk is not allowed in EncName.

test-case.name: K-VersionProlog-3
test-case.description: Whitespace is not allowed in EncName.

test-case.name: K-VersionProlog-3-v3
test-case.description: Whitespace is not allowed in EncName.

test-case.name: K-VersionProlog-4
test-case.description: Vertical bar is not allowed in EncName.

test-case.name: K-VersionProlog-4-v3
test-case.description: Vertical bar is not allowed in EncName.

test-case.name: K-VersionProlog-2
test-case.description: A simple version declaration excluding encoding.

test-case.name: K-VersionProlog-2-v3
test-case.description: A simple version declaration excluding encoding.

test-case.name: prolog-version-4
test-case.description: Simple version decl.

test-case.name: prolog-version-4-v3
test-case.description: Simple version decl.

test-case.name: prolog-version-5
test-case.description: An XQuery 1.0 processor must accept version "1.0".

modified.change: Change dependency from XQ10+ to XQ10.

test-case.name: prolog-version-5-v3
test-case.description: An XQuery 3.0 processor must accept version "3.0".

modified.change: Bug fix related to bug #14955: Added dependenct XQ30+
Change dependency from XQ30+ to XQ30.

test-case.name: prolog-version-6
test-case.description: A more realistic query with a version decl, no encoding.

result.assert-xml: <title>Data on the Web</title><title>TCP/IP Illustrated</title><title>Advanced Programming in the Unix environment</title><title>The Economics of Technology and Content for Digital TV</title>

test-case.name: prolog-version-6-v3
test-case.description: A more realistic query with a version decl, no encoding.

result.assert-xml: <title>Data on the Web</title><title>TCP/IP Illustrated</title><title>Advanced Programming in the Unix environment</title><title>The Economics of Technology and Content for Digital TV</title>

test-case.name: prolog-version-7
test-case.description: A more realitic query with a version decl, no encoding.

result.assert-xml: <title>Data on the Web</title><title>TCP/IP Illustrated</title><title>Advanced Programming in the Unix environment</title><title>The Economics of Technology and Content for Digital TV</title>

test-case.name: prolog-version-7-v3
test-case.description: A more realitic query with a version decl, no encoding.

result.assert-xml: <title>Data on the Web</title><title>TCP/IP Illustrated</title><title>Advanced Programming in the Unix environment</title><title>The Economics of Technology and Content for Digital TV</title>

test-case.name: version_declaration-005
test-case.description: A more realistic query with a version decl, no encoding

test-case.name: prolog-version-1
test-case.description: Prolog version declaration with both version and encoding information (set to 1.0 and "utf-8" respectively.

test-case.name: prolog-version-1-v3
test-case.description: Prolog version declaration with both version and encoding information (set to 3.0 and "utf-8" respectively.

test-case.name: prolog-version-3
test-case.description: Prolog version declaration with both version and encoding information (set to 1.0 and "US-ASCII" respectively.

test-case.name: prolog-version-3-v3
test-case.description: Prolog version declaration with both version and encoding information (set to 3.0 and "US-ASCII" respectively.

test-case.name: K-VersionProlog-5
test-case.description: A prolog containing many different declarations. TODO function declarations missing TODO variable declarations missing

test-case.name: K-VersionProlog-5-v3
test-case.description: A prolog containing many different declarations. TODO function declarations missing TODO variable declarations missing

test-case.name: version_declaration-023-v3
test-case.description: In XQuery 3.0, you *can* omit the 'version' clause.

test-case.name: K2-VersionProlog-1
test-case.description: a string literal reminding of an xquery version declaration.

test-case.name: K2-VersionProlog-2
test-case.description: a string literal reminding of an xquery version declaration.

test-case.name: K2-VersionProlog-4
test-case.description: Whitespace isn't allowed after a prefix in a QName.

test-case.name: K2-VersionProlog-5
test-case.description: Check that the 'xquery' name test is parsed correctly.
